bestBHT.bht: Consider the lilies in the field, they exist and live there among the grass. Instead of worrying about what you will eat or drink, trust in God's care for the grass and how He clothes it. If God takes such care of the grass, which is more excellent in nature and designed for greater purposes, why should those of little faith worry about their own provision? Have faith in God, for He will surely provide for you.

Marvin Vincent: Construe in the field with the grass; and render is absolutely: exists, lives."
Oven [κλιβανον]. Strictly, a covered earthen vessel, wider at bottom than at top, in which bread was baked by putting hot embers round it."
And seek not what ye, etc. Ye is emphatic: 'and ye, seek not what,' etc.
Archibald T. Robertson: Clothe (αμφιαζε). Late Greek verb in the Koine (papyri) for the older form αμφιεννυμ (Matthew 6:30). See Matthew for discussion of details. Matthew has "the grass of the field" instead of "the grass in the field" as here.
John Gill: If then God so clothe the grass...how much more will he clothe you, O ye of little faith?
They are more excellent in their nature, and of a longer duration, and are designed for greater ends and purposes.
Such who are distrustful and diffident in this matter, may well be called men of little faith.
John Wesley: The grass — The Greek word means all sorts of herbs and flowers.

bhtAttempts.bht: Construe in the field with the grass; and render is absolutely: exists, lives. Seek not what ye, etc. Ye is emphatic: 'and ye, seek not what,' etc. Clothe (αμφιαζε). Late Greek verb in the Koine (papyri) for the older form αμφιεννυμ (Matthew 6:30). If then God so clothe the grass...how much more will he clothe you, O ye of little faith? They are more excellent in their nature, and of a longer duration, and are designed for greater ends and purposes. Such who are distrustful and diffident in this matter, may well be called men of little faith. The grass — The Greek word means all sorts of herbs and flowers.

Construe that God's provision exists and thrives in the field among the grass, reminding us not to be consumed with seeking material possessions. Instead, trust that if God clothes the grass with beauty and sustains it, He will surely provide for His people. Those who doubt His provision could be described as lacking faith. The term grass encompasses all types of herbs and flowers, signifying the excellence, longevity, and purpose found in God's creations.

Construe in the field with the grass existing and thriving, and seek not what ye, etc. Clothe the grass, how much more will he clothe you, O ye of little faith? They are more excellent in their nature and designed for greater purposes. Such who are distrustful may well be called men of little faith. The grass — all sorts of herbs and flowers.

Consider the lilies. Exist and live in the field with the grass, and don't seek what you will eat or what you will drink. God cares for the grass in the field and gives it clothing, so how much more will he clothe you, O people of little faith? Just as God takes care of the grass, which is more excellent in nature and designed for greater purposes, He will certainly provide for you. Trust in His provision and have faith.

Consider the lilies in the field, they exist and live there among the grass. Instead of worrying about what you will eat or drink, trust in God's care for the grass and how He clothes it. If God takes such care of the grass, which is more excellent in nature and designed for greater purposes, why should those of little faith worry about their own provision? Have faith in God, for He will surely provide for you.
